channel.title: Help with website
channel.description:
well i am kinda new to websites, so i made a free account at byethost and got 5gb space and 10gb bandwith.
i want to be able to upload some videos and pictures in a seperate page, is there any script for doing that. thanks in advance, i know i am a newbie to web

item.title: Help with website
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:13, topic:322339”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=418744.msg3079584#msg3079584 date=1262059317]

[quote author=inertia link=topic=418744.msg3078339#msg3078339 date=1261998595]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=418744.msg3077852#msg3077852 date=1261966504]

You want to upload pictures/videos via your browser or threw an FTP client?
[/quote]…
if you are uploading via a browser, it is obviously using an online-ftp-client…

um, php?
[/quote]ftp via php…

I learn something new every day, I never realised PHP uploaded files via FTP.
[/quote]was that sarcasm, because i honestly cannot detect it

unless the webhost sucks dick, any php script it provides to upload files will use ftp (the other method is to manually choose the directory and upload via file-operations (fopen, fwrite, fclose))

http://uk3.php.net/manual/en/function.move-uploaded-file.php

That’s what most file upload scripts use, and it’s not FTP…[/quote]umm most if not all web-hosting providers’ upload script makes use of their (s)ftp server

Read full topic

item.title: Help with website
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:12, topic:322339”][quote author=inertia link=topic=418744.msg3078339#msg3078339 date=1261998595]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=418744.msg3077852#msg3077852 date=1261966504]

[quote author=inertia link=topic=418744.msg3077630#msg3077630 date=1261954040]

You want to upload pictures/videos via your browser or threw an FTP client?
[/quote]…
if you are uploading via a browser, it is obviously using an online-ftp-client…

um, php?
[/quote]ftp via php…

I learn something new every day, I never realised PHP uploaded files via FTP.
[/quote]was that sarcasm, because i honestly cannot detect it

unless the webhost sucks dick, any php script it provides to upload files will use ftp (the other method is to manually choose the directory and upload via file-operations (fopen, fwrite, fclose))[/quote]
http://uk3.php.net/manual/en/function.move-uploaded-file.php

That’s what most file upload scripts use, and it’s not FTP…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with website
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:7, topic:322339”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=418744.msg3077525#msg3077525 date=1261948432]

through filezila So FTP client

Did you setup a ftp account through your web host?
[/quote]Generally. If it’s shared hosting, then yes.

yes[/quote]
Then in filezilla enter your ftp server, ftp username/password, hit connect and once it connects, from there you can add/modify/delete files.

Read full topic
